title: Netflix fans say horror film Eerie means they are "not going to be able to sleep"

Hold onto your hats, because you're about to be scared witless.

Netflix viewers have taken to social media in droves due to the terrifying Filipino horror film Eerie.

The film is set in an all-girls Catholic school following a student's suicide, with a guidance counselor being forced to uncover some dark truths about the convent's past.

The added twist is that she is a clairvoyant and the truth will require some contact with the dead.

Streaming giant Netflix picked up the rights to the horror earlier this year and now horror fans are calling it one of the scariest films of the year.

One fan on Twitter said: "If you want to watch a really good Horror movie which isn't only about jump scares but had a strong storyline. I heavily suggest "Eerie" on Netflix. It's a movie from the Philippines."

(Image: Netflix)

Another wrote: "scary movies with subtitles are the worst cus i actually have to pay attention to the screen"

Meanwhile, on Netflix viewer wrote: "I watched the Eerie the other night on netflix! Filipino horror movie done right! Watch it guys!"

One brave soul said: "Ok...I'm going to attempt to watch Eerie on @netflix tonight...alone....with lights off....who thinks I will last the whole movie and who thinks I'll turn it off after 30 mins?"

(Image: Netflix)

Finally, one viewer wrote: "Watching #Eerie on Netflix. Definitely not going to be able to sleep after watching it. #scary "

Well, if you think you can brave it, let us know what you think!

Eerie is available now on Netflix.

Have you watched Eerie on Netflix? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below.
description: Eerie is a Filipino horror film that has left Netflix viewers shaken as it terrifies fans on the streaming service
